review: It's a good system if you want to just want to watch movies but when it comes to gaming the graphics are good and it is very fluid.  The only problem that I have with the system is on the 8gb that you have, 2gb is dedicated to the memory so that only leaves you with 6gb for storage.  Now look at today's games that are coming in (Modern combat 4, 1.9gb and asphalt 8 which is 1.2gb...etc) it takes up all the space so you have to delete everything on there just to put another app on there.  Don't get me wrong, if you are just using it for movies and tv it blows any other box (Apple, Roku, Chromecast...etc) out of the water but if you like gaming like I do it needs more storage (32gb-128gb) or an micro sd card slot to store games or movies.  Better yet have the system be able to freely be rooted so we can put a 1tb storage on there.

review: I have tried, on three separate occasions to use an Amazon Fire TV. Two out of the three units that I bought gave me the same negative results. On Amazon Prime and Netflix, I received messages that said either "Unknown Error", or just "Error - Try Again". This was over and over. I could not connect with either of them. The third one, which was really the first one that I bought, was, and still is fine. So, for my other two TVs I am back to using a Roku, which have never failed me.My suggestion to those that are considering buying this unit is to read all of the 1, 2, and 3 star reviews of this product before you purchase one of these.
author: Pamela

review: Things noticed switching from Logitech revue Google TV:-video occasionally stutters/glitches in Netflix-no USB thumb drive/HDD support-no real YouTube app, can't watch Google play purchased items. A handful were able to play through a weird YouTube 3rd party app that's basically a web version of YouTube for TV, but not the ones that counted.-Netflix is treated like a 3rd party app, and you can't pin apps where you want it. So you go dig through your apps, and then after picking it on a second screen hit launch app. Seems like a dumb complaint, but coming from a Logitech revue with Google TV, it is less convenient.-remote is tiny, and easy to lose. And having a keyboard with touchpad as well implemented as the Revue's, with universal search, I do miss being able to quickly get to exactly what you want.All the other features are true. Its much faster, voice search works well only for select content providers, hardware is small and solid, easy to use.
